title: MS NOW - Wikipedia
snippet: MSNBC was established in 1996 under a strategic partnership between NBC and Microsoft. NBC executive Tom Rogers was instrumental in developing the partnership. James Kinsella, a Microsoft executive, served as president of the online component, MSNBC.com, and represented the technology company ...

title: MSNBC to rebrand to MS NOW
snippet: MSNBC, the progressive cable network owned by NBCUniversal, is rebranding to MS NOW, an acronym that stands for My Source for News, Opinion and the World. Why it matters: The rebrand is part of a wider effort by NBCU to create a distinction ...

title: Why MS NOW? What the MSNBC name change means for viewers - Los Angeles Times
snippet: Mika Brzezinski and Joe Scarborough on “Morning Joe.” ... MS NOW — an acronym for “My Source for News, Opinion and the World” — is the result of the politically progressive network being spun off into a company called Versant.

title: MSNBC to change name to MS NOW amid spinoff from NBCUniversal
snippet: MSNBC will change its name to MS Now, for My Source News Opinion World, and unveil a new logo this year as part of the cable news channel’s spinoff from the Comcast-owned media company NBCUniversal

title: MSNBC is becoming MS NOW. What to know about the change and how to watch.
snippet: The transition comes as MSNBC breaks off from its current parent company, Comcast NBCUniversal, and moves into Versant, an independent media company.
